text: Bottle shared with Esp0r and simonsen at the Beer & Boardgames in the woods trip 2016. Black body with a beige head. Aroma of intense chocolate, sweet cherry syrup, bourbon and vanilla. Taste follows the same notes, adding a balancing cherry tartness, roasted malt and earthy notes. Sweet vanilla and cherry finish, with a lasting strong cocoa note. Excellent.
Flaske. Svart f arge, moderat med tynn skumtopp. Smaker rosin,brent malt,sjokolade, og kaffe. Muy bien

Intensiv malziger Antrunk, Schokolade und Vanille. Milde Noten von Kirschen, minimale Säure. Das Ganze ist ziemlich süffig, dabei übernimmt die Säure das Zepter, das Malz kommt dadurch schwächer hervor. Dadurch wirkt das Bier insgesamt milder und nicht mehr so vollmundig wie zu Beginn. 10/12/9/8/11/9

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ x-mas evening. Late. No head low carbonation. Spicyness blended with roasted coffee notes. A hybrid. Some sour dry mouthfeel. More speciel than gentle. Okay...... its crazy.

"Soft Dookie :) was a great beer - really lookin forward to this. However, the cherry aspect was too sour and acidic to mesh well with the vanilla and chocolate awesomeness. By the end I still enjoyed it, but toned down sour (or just a hint of sweet cherry instead) would have been sooooo much better."

Bottle shared by alexsdad06 pours opaque black. Nose some black licorice, roasted coffee, maraschino cherry, chocolate . Almost like cherry cordial ice cream. Taste nice milk chocolate, light roast, mid palate sweet malt and smooth mouth. Hints of cherry mid palate. The flavors return fir awesome mix of flavors in the finish.
Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours black, nose is light cherry and vanilla, taste is rich chocolate, sweet, fruity.

Appearance: Very dark brown, black-ish. Some dark tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, coffee, cherry.
Taste: Dark malt, roasted, coffee, chocolate, then the sweet cherry-bus hits you. Pretty good.
Info: 500ml bottle, 30/5-2014, BB: 1/1-2015

24.04.2014, 0,5l bottle @ BBGTC tasting:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, caramel malts, sugar, vanilla/yoghurt candy, grass, sweet red berries, dark sugar. Taste is slightly sour-ish fruity, dark malts, hay, sorrel, sour red berries, harsh vanilla, yoghurt, grass, dark sugar. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh sour-ish mouthfeel. Nice enough.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Pours a pitch black body with a medium creamy beige head. Nose is shoe polish-like leather tones, vanilla, dark chocolate, hints of cocoa and red fruits. Taste is clove, vanilla, cinnamon, dark chocolate, citric peel, bitter herbs and hints of caramel and cherry yoghurt. Full body, soft to medium carbonation. Not really working for, this one - the sour-ish fruity touch doesnt rhyme too well with the rest of the beer.

Pours a thick and viscous black producing a small tan head. Aroma is heavy leather, tar, moderate roast and sweet malty caramel. Taste is sweet and roasty with hints of vanilla and cherries. Thick and creamy on the palate. Soft carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2014 Pours pitch black with a small tan fizz. Smells strongly of the vanilla and sour cherries. Taste is medicinal cherries; strongly tart cherry flavor. Full-bodied with a slick texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Evil Twin Soft Xmas aka Pretty Please with a Cherry on Top finishes with a prickly medicinal flavor.
Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh, Dec 12. Pours black, thin tan head. Coffee, chocolate, raisins. Taste and aroma. Big mouthfeel, rich. Nice.
Backlog fra Cardinals crazy juleølsmaking. Jeg ticket alle de øllene, men så at de da ikke kom med på Statistikk, så nå blir det sånn ca...

bottle from Bierkompass. Deep brown, almost black with a brown-beige head. Fruity nose. Slightly sour, very nice cherry flavours, not as artificial as in other cherry beers Ive tasted. Sweet and fruity with a shy but pleasant sourness, hints of dark chocolate. All in all, a very pleasant beer.
Bottle from a beershop in Copenhagen. Fruity and light roasted smell with cherries. Similar taste. I like the residiual sweetness in this one. Lots of flavour but feels well balanced.

500 ml bottle, Cardinals great Yule beer tasting. ABV is 10.9%. Pitch black colour, moderate to low brown head. Strong aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla, mild coffee and sour cherries. The flavour has a distinct sourish fruity acidity from the cherries, also smooth chocolate. Some bitterness and wood in the finish. Maybe not well balanced, but interesting and fun to drink.

The taste starts with a slight tang, continuing with a refreshing sour cherry into a long slightly-roasty chocolate and coffee finish that slowly dissipates, finishing with slight tannic coffee. The sour components of this beer really meld well, though I would not call this a sour. It is medium-bodied, not quite what youd expect for a stout, but it works well with this beer. The alcohol, though high, is not apparent. Overall I though this was a very good beer.
Bottle. Color dark brown with small brown head. Aroma malt, roasted, chocolate, cherry, vanilla. Taste malt, alcohol, wood, cherry.

Bottle from Johns Market, Portland. Pours a dark-medium reddish brown. Aroma is effing huge, chocolate, smoke, cherries, barrels. Body on the thinner side. Finish fairly abrupt, a hint of bitterness.
January 2012. 12 ox. bottle. The addition of vanilla and cherries to the Soft DK beer really makes a great difference and makes this for a unique brew. Great balance and complexity.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Nose was a little weaker than I'd like. Cherry note is a nice addition to the base beer but there's a little metallic twinge that detracts from it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. An opaque black beer, with a large, frothy, lacing, mostly lasting, light brown head. The aroma is moderately to heavily malty (roasted grain, dark chocolate, cocoa powder, hint of molasses and coffee), with a strong note of vanilla, other notes of cherry and alcohol. The flavor is heavily sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Full body, creamy/thick texture, soft carbonation, long finish with light to moderate bitterness, moderately alcoholic. Definately a nice surprise. Superior in each aspect: inviting appearence, powerful but not overwhelming aroma, with a balancing acidity and a great, creamy mouthfeel. Perhaps Im overrating, but I really enjoyed the whole bottle. Best Evil Twin beer? IMHO yes, at least among those I have tasted.

Bottle shared by Tmoney99 Dec 2011.  Pours dark brown in color with a thin off white head.  The aroma is roasted malts, black cherry with a light tart note, chocolate with a light vanilla sweetness.  The flavor had roasted malts, chocolate, black cherry, light tart character, vanilla with some black coffee at the finish.  Smooth and slightly syrupy mouth feel.

21st January 2012Opaque black - brown beer. Tidy tan head. Surprisingly light palate, crisp as well. Something of a neopolitan vibe here. Dark chocolate underneath tart cherry, smothered with well integrated vanilla.A little hop bitterness before the semi dry finish, arrests and cloy from the sweet flavours.

Refrigerated brown bottle put on the counter and then poured into a white wine glass.  Pours black with small light brown head that dissapates quickly.  Little lacing, thick body, medium carbonation, and light cherry & roasted malt aroma.  Taste is roasted malt, bitter coffee, some vanilla, some dark chocolate, and light herbal hops.  I would say this more of an imperial stout than a fruit beer.  Better as it warmed; chill and serve as an imperial stout.  A little hard to drink and as far as cherry stouts I think I prefer NG cherry stout.

A - Dark black with a finger of frothy chocolate head. Fades medium.

S - Roasted chocolate malts, cherries and other dark fruits, vanilla, molasses, black licorice, coffee, and some booze.

T - Chocolate malts, cherries, dark fruits, vanilla, molasses, black licorice, some earthy malts, a bit of bitterness, some roasted espresso, and a bit of booze.

M - Medium-full bodied moderate carbonation. Smooth and a bit thick with a sweet, warming finish.

D - Bold and complex, but great balance. The extra vanilla and cherries are very nice.

Name: Soft Xmas
Date: December 29, 2012
Mode: Bottle
Source: Appachelian Vinters, Asheville
Appearance: black, creamy tan head, streaks of lace
Aroma: rich roasted aroma, balancing fruity sweetness
Flavor: sweet roasted flavor, sweet cherry well balanced with the rich roasted malt
Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 15/20
Rating: 3.6/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: *** /4

Flaske kjøpt på Ølbutikken: i studietiden var noen av de store oppdagelsene Cherry Heering, Anthon Bergs Blomme i Madeira og 
Jordbær i Champagne. Dette er ølversjonen. Det er bra at de har brukt sure kirsebær, ellers ville sødmen blitt uoverkommelig. Det høye vitamininnholdet gjør også sitt til at dette glir bekymringsløst over ganen.

Cask at the Brewdog Bar, Camden. Pours a dark mahogany with no head and little life. The aroma is rich, fruity and with big cherries. The flavour is uber rich chewy bitter and of course with cherries too. Its a wonderful change of direction for a Christmas ale and very well executed.

500ml bottle bought at Ølbutikken, Copenhagen in May this year. Opaque, pitch black body. Tan-coloured head reduced to a remaining layer. Just a few dotted spots to the glassware. Inviting aroma of chocolate layered cherry, as well as hints of vanilla and wood. The cherry part is stronger to the taste buds than to the nose partially offset by chocolate and burnt vanilla. Sweet and tart ending. Dry and smooth in the mouth. Not the usual kind of Danish Christmas ales. Different and likeable, but one whole bottle was a bit over the top (late night sipper at home, Tromsø 27.12.2012).

Draft at Brewdog.  Pours black with a ring beige head.  Aroma is dominated by cherry with milk chocolate behind.  Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter.  Fairly thick mouthfeel, full bodied and soft carbonation.

500ml bottle. Black with a short brown head. Slightly subdued aroma of chocolate malt and cherries. Begins with sweet cocoa, hints of bourbon and vanilla, then evolves into waves of cherry. Good mouthfeel and easily drinkable. I found the cherry to be integrated really well, and the whole thing is nice and understated, but I just felt it needed a little more pizzazz to rank in the top tier.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy powerfull aroma. Light bitter ugly flavor. Totally unbalanced beer between chryy, smoke and chocolate. Average light bitter finish, Oily palate.

Nearly black opaque pour w/ a huge oatmeal like brown head w/ some thick lacing.  First aroma is a big hint of rich chocolate a tiny bit of cherry and loads of vanilla after it calms down just a little bit.  Palate is well coated and lightly creamy.  Flavor starts with rich roasty malts then a good amount of tart cherry, almost a bit much in that a slightly subtler amount of the tartness would have created a better balance.  Still quite delicious and easy to drink, the flavor actually improves the blend as it warms up and mellows a touch.

Bottle. Black with tan head. Aroma is cherry, fudge and vanilla. Taste starts soft with vanilla then turns acidic with notes of red berries, tobacco, dark malt, chocolate. I don't like the acidic feel, but I like the vanilla/cherry/roasted malt combination.

More cherry stout than imperial stout with cherry.  Expensive $16 bomber purchased in New York this year.  Black with little head.  A decent stout, and I do like cherry, but not the best balance of the two.  Maybe some chocolate would help make it more of a dessert beer. Some roast aroma.  Tarter cherry might be nice.  Maybe it has to be drunk very fresh.Drinkable.

Pours thick black with bubbly tan head.  Aroma mostly sour cherries with some roast and malts.  Taste again sour cherries with chocolate, dark malts and slight roast.  Thick and creamy palate.  Finish slight chocolate with some sourness and bitterness.
Pretty good but I liked the regular soft dookie better.

Pours pitch black with a medium creamy tan head...nice lacing.  Aroma is like one of those chocolate covered cherries that are all gooey inside...mild burnt notes.  Flavor follows suit but is more roasty and bitter...very mild soury note from the cherry...not getting vanilla.  Mouthfeel is medium/full with a dark chocolate cherry finish that warms a bit.

Bottled at ekstedt dec-11
Black with a small, beige head.
Loads of dark toffee in the aroma.
Milky chocolate in the flavour with light notes of cherries. Vanilla and slightly sourish.

Bottle.  Pours light absorbing opaque with a medium, thick frothy brown head, medium-short retention with spotty lacing.  Aroma is sour cherry, roast and chocolate malt, light vanilla, earthy hops, licorice, and plums/prunes.  Flavor is heavy malt, tart chocolate covered cherries, light hops and bitterness, dark fruity esters and a dry finish.  Full body, medium carbonation.
Smooth and creamy with an overwelhming taste of chocolate and cherry. Very dark and warm... It smells, looks and taste like XMas

Pours black with a red tint and a tan head. Smells of cream and cherries. Full bodied and thick, a bit boozy. Sweet cherry cola flavored with vanilla cream

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Bruisin ales - pours a dark brown with a milk chocolate head that fades to tan. Aroma is malty, vanilla, and cherries. Taste is sweet and tart. Palate is creamy. Nice!

Bottle to oversized snifter.  Looks good; pitch plack with dark-beige lacing.  Smells solid; sweet and malty with some vanilla.  Tastes like it smells, only better, and with some cherry in there too.  Nice and creamy on the palate.  Damn good beer!
Bottle. Black with a creamy light brown head. Chocolate cola nut black licorice and drip coffee aroma and taste with a dry bitter roasted grain finish. Creamy citrusy palate.

500ml bottle.
Pours pitch black, with a strange reddish hue, and a brown/pink/beige head.
Fruity, roasted aroma, malt, chocolate, vanilla, cherries, tobacco, caramel, fudge.
Off-dry, medium body and bitterness, creamy CO2.
Fruity, slightly acidic taste, roasted malt, cherries, vanilla, tobacco. The cherries and tartness crash full frontal with the roasted malts, doesnt work for me. Well made, anyway.
(2012-06-26)

En nas, vainilles, xuxeries i sidral de cola. En boca entrada dolça, després té un punt àcid i al final és una mica amarga i cafetera. Molt extraña. Difícil de beure i de recomenar. No macaba de convèncer. Massa rara.

This is, hands down, the best cherry stout Ive ever tasted. Poured at a good temperature with a decent sized, tan, foamy, frothy, sudsy, head with brown highlights that lasts a while and lots of lace. Color is an almost opaque ruby red. Aroma is lots of roast, natural cherry, malt, cocoa, coffee, toffee, vanilla, caramel. Flavors like nose, abosutley perfectly  balanced and aesthetically pleasing blend of sweet, bitter, carbonic and sour cherry tang. Usually, for me, cherry clashes with the bitterness and tang at some point; not this one. Body is not soft, but not coarse, has some high point that are expected from sour cherry - to me perfect and ditto carbonaton. Finish is very long and boozy. Incredible beer.

Bottle shared by a friend. Black pour with a thick tan head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, cherry and vanilla. Chocolate and vanilla flavor with tart cherry fruitiness before a bitter dark chocolate finish.

Backlog dec 2011
On bottle at Schouskjelleren
Intense aromas of cherry choclate- overwhelms everything else.
Its to far out for me

Botella de 500ml. Vaso Tumbler. Saboreada en dic´11. Color ruby oscuro. Espuma beige rojiza de espuma pequeña que crea una corona cremosa y de capa amplia. Copos y collares abundantes. Aromas de maltas tostadas dulces, malta caramelo, frutos rojos y notas de chocolate en nariz. La entrada es increíble: como un caramelo de chocolate y cereza que explota en la boca, seguido por maltas tostadas dulces en el paladar. Un ligero amargor  subyacente, en el intermedio, nos recuerda que se trata de una cerveza. Permanece hasta el final como una infusión de chocolate afrutado. Agradable azucarado y bien equilibrado ABV. Matices de cerezas. Cuerpo pleno y carbonatación suave. Malteado dulce y moderado lúpulo en el retrogusto. ¡ Feliz Navidad !, ¿no os parece?.
500ml bottle. Tumbler glass. Enjoyed on dec´11. Deep ruby color. Reddish beige, small bubbled  froth creates a thick layer creamy crown. Copious spots & collars. Sweet toasted malts, caramel malt, red fruits & chocolate notes to the nose. Unbelievable upfront: like a chocolate&cherry candy explodes in mouth followed by sweet toasted malts on to the palate. An slightly underlying bitterness shows it´s a beer in the middle. It lingers through into the finish like a fruity chocolate infusion. Nice sugary & well balanced ABV. Hints of cherries. Full body, soft carbonation. Sweet malty & mildy hoppy aftertaste. Merry Xmas !, ain´t it?

Draft at Farmers Cacbinet. Pours a pitch black color. Aroma is very cherry, almost like cherry air freshener, i know that doesnt sound appealing but its pretty good. Taste is very rounded, smooth, easy to drink. Cherry flavor comes through really nicely with the dark chocolate flavors. Really nice.

Flaske: Kulsort øl med et lille skumhoved. Duften er let sure kirsebær med en god del brændt malt oveni. Smagen er syrlige krisebær med en god del alkohol og brændt malt. Meget meget julet, men det fungerer godt. Fin øl.
Bottle. Black pour, light tan head. Sour cherries, chocolate, vanilla, dark fruit, cinnamon, all with that unique Soft Dookie chalkiness.
Doft av choklad och kaffe. Smak av bitter choklad, tydlig beska, vanilj, körsbären uteblir, lite schizofren. 4p av 10 i Julölsprovningen 2011.

Bottle shared with pat, Vinny and dave. Pours a deep chocolate black body. Aroma is sweet and sour cherries, vanilla, and cinnamon. Mouthfeel is creamy with notes of chocolate covered sour cherries, sweet vanilla, oak, and cinnamon.

Bottle with friends, compliments of James. Pours a dark purple. Beige cream head. Aromas of squashed cherries, chocolate, beemster, cinnamon, and sour cherry. Taste was a perfectly balanced chocolate covered cherry profile with tons of delicious malt and vanilla in the back end. This beer was rad.
Night black with lasting head. Vanilla, cherries and chocolate aroma, somewhat sweet and very light co2.

$16.99 bottle with a best before of 2015. Pours with a dark black hue with a persistent tan head with good lace and retention.  Aromas are of dark chocolate, plums, prunes, sweet cherries, esters, alcohol cocoa powder, earthy, vanilla and a bit bready. Flavors are vanilla, earthy, fudge, cherry, tannin, light acidity, astringent/soil character, chocolate. Moderately husky. Syrupy mouthfeel, lighter carbonation. I am not a fan of the acidic and earthy/soily edge on this. Not my cup of tea.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2012 Bottle. Pours dark, dark brown with almost no head. Aroma of vanilla, chocolate and cherries. Flavor is sweet with a semi-tart finish. Also a little bit vinegary. Medium body and a lot of carbonation.

pours a a dark black hue with a small white head that is mostly diminishing
aroma of chocolate, cherries, cocoa, coffee, and some dark fruits
flavor is of cherry chocolate cake
medium mouth feel with light carb

This took me off guard, pours a dark black that forms a thin khaki head, aroma of chocolate, faint cherries and strong vanilla. Flavor brings the cherries out more, I expected them to be pretty muted by the strong vanilla chocolate combo, this beer tastes like a cella cherry but better, well done, would love to see a barrel aged one.

Bottle......it pours pitch black with a medium creamy brown head.....The aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, some coffee and some sweet cherries.....the flavor is sour, cherries, hard roasted malt, vanilla and chocolate .......cherries sour finish.... Very nice!!

500mL bottle, pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, chili pepper, and cherry - weird mix. Flavour is slightly spicy with notes of maraschino cherry upfront, with chocolate cake buried further underneath - some roasty, slightly smoky notes in there too. Finishes cherry-like and roasty, with a slight sour tinge and no boozy burn - well-incorporated for near-11%. Full-bodied and robust. Finally, a cherry & chocolate stout done very well.

500. Pours jet black with a dense and creamy dark tan head that settles fairly quickly to a layer of suds. Big chocolate vanilla cherry nose, and the cherry quality wavers somewhere between fake sugar and super tart. I think something happens to sour cherries during fermentation that gives their aromatics a synthetic quality. Creamy medium body with soft carb. Rich roasty base with tons of cloying vanilla and cherry. A fair bit too sweet, really.
Draft. Dark mahogony beer with a tan head. Vanilla and sweet malt aroma. Cherry and chocolate flavor with vanilla. Medium-plus bodied. Cherry and vanilla lingers with chocolate and toffee.

50 cl bottle, BBE 2015
Very nice aroma with lots of chocolate, cocoa powder, hints of mocha and vanilla. Flavour starts with sourness, continues as tart and complex with chocolate, some cherries, peat and hints of brown sugar. Finishes dry with tart currants, cherries and currant bush. After all, slightly too tart and sour for me. The aroma promises a bit more than the flavour has to offer.

50 cl bottle @ Timo A. BBE 2015.
Pours dark brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of sweet milky chocolate, ash, mild fruity overtones, vanilla, mild berry notes. Flavor of mild sour cherries, ashy chocolate, vanilla, peat, mild fruity notes and maybe some currant bush notes. Very ashy dry palate with a sour aftertaste. Surprisingly complex brew with a nice balanced union of different flavors. Top notch.
4437

Keg at BrewDog. Deep brown/black, reddish highlights, thin tan head. Big funky sour cherries, hint of vanilla, dark chocolate, really rich nose. Sweet front, cherries and vanilla, dark chocolate, nutty oak notes, cola also, slight sourness, medium body with a slight roasty fruity blackcurrant finish. Lovely!

Bottle from Ledgers Liquors, Berkeley. Pour jet blac with an attractive tan head and a chocolate cherry aroma. Just as I expected, the flavor too is chocolate and sour cherry with a very dry slightly bitter finish. A nice twist on the dookie.

bottle at Blue Monk< Buffalo. dark medium to lighter bodied pour. great chocolate covered cherry pour, cherry was really evident in flavor, almost too much. Its like someone dropped cherry ludens into a chocolate stout. cherry seems awkward to me. Great aroma but ok balance

Bottle. A black one, with a reddish tint. Theres a reddish touch the head as well, its dense, fingerthick and brown. Some vanilla in the aroma, also a hint of cherries, with roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and a hint of caramel. Unusual flavor for an imperial stout, but the added vanilla and cherries gives it a nice and interesting touch. Some bitterness towards the end. Full-bodied, smooth and lighlty warming. I like it, its unusual, but tasteful.
Aromas of chocolate and coffee.  Pours black with a creamy brown head. Flavors of chocolate covered cherries which linger on the palate.  Overall a very good stout.

Bottle from City Beer. Pours very dark brown/black with a 2 finger creamy dark tan head. Aromas of chocolate and vanilla over smooth burnt malt. Near full bodied. Flavor is very chocolate/vanilla, and theres cherry that doesnt seem sour. This is very much dessert. Chocolate with a cherry on top. Fits. Heat is entirely absent. This is very good.

4oz taster at DBS. Aroma is freshly stained cherry/olive wood. Taste is similar with a sour cherry presence that throws this beer off track a bit. Almost the oddness you experience when eating chocolate-covered maraschino cherries. Didnt like this one to end on. Pretty good beer, but odd.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Craigs. A black beer with a thick tan head that dies away fairly quickly. Lovely aroma of vanilla, chocolate and cherry. Upfront vanilla flavour with coffee, chocolate and delicious tart cherries. Moderate carbonation and a chewy mouth-feel. Excellent!

bottle at home ... deep black ... thin tan head ... sweet cherry fruits ... big vanilla ... chocolate malts ...  smells wonderfull nose ... dark chocolate malts ... deep roast ... lovely complex vanilla ... with tart sour cherry ... the vanilla sweetness balances the sour cherry wonderfully.

Local Belmont botle. This was interesting. It semmed to me like a rather strong, dry stout that had hints of fruity sweetnes. The base beer is not overpowered by the fruit. Alcohol is well hidden. Well done overall.
Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Nose/taste of roast chocolate, sour cherries, cocoa, vanilla and light coffee. Mild sourness in finish from the cherries. Medium body.

From tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. A near pitch black one with a small sidesticking tan chocolate head. Roasted chocolate aroma with some Belgian chocolate, vanilla and cookie dough. Light prickling on the carbonation level and it feels dry and oily in the mouthfeel. It has some sour touches this one. Licorice and burned spicy malts makes this quite interesting and flavorful. Lasting licorice, roasted malts and a different chocolate + vanilla finish and aftertaste. A bit sweet and sour also. Enjoyable! 06.01.2012

Tap, growler, bottle. Dark brown with red hue, nice creamy  beige head. Aroma - cherries, coffee, chocolate, roasted malt and caramel. At some point also cocoa. Taste dark malt, vanilla, coffee (not very bitter coffee) cherries, vanilla and a sour cherries- ending. The balance in aroma and taste changes a lot with temperature.
This beer is one of a kind and somehow it works.  Props for making a fun/weird and rather enjoyable beer.

Black pour with small tan head. Big vanilla nose. Light body. Vanilla and cherry extract. Sweet and roasted malts . Lingering semi sweet finish.  tastes TOO much like flavorings.  Not well integrated but would taste awesome as an ice cream float.

Botella. Deep dark brown colour, light brown steady head, good lacing. Sweet fruity (dark) vanilla malty chocolate aroma. Good mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet and fruity, sour like in a nice way,  dark malty with plenty of roasty like caramel, chocolate, dark fruit and vanilla.

Bottle. Black pour with a frothy brown head. Kind of looks like an opaque Dr. Pepper. Aroma is roasted malt, tobacco, vanilla, coffee, dark fruit, chocolate notes and ash. Taste is big roasted malt, tobacco, vanilla, oily coffee beans, chocolate covered cherries, slight tartness from the fruit and burnt caramel. Finishes with tart cherries, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, faint soy sauce, and light tobacco.

Sample, on tap at Jackie-Os. Black color, medium-brown head. Light carbonation. Very smooth, creamy texture. Kind of a seemingly lighter body. The cherry and vanilla is noticeable in the aroma, gives this a sort of tart sweetness. Interesting for sure.
Blackish with a large brown head. Aroma of cookie dough, tofee and chocolate. Complex flavor. Lots of chocolate fudge and caramel, light peat, lambic sourness and bitter roastd notes. Bold brew.

A deep dark stout with a thin dark brown head. In aroma, a nice nutty chocolate with light sweet cherries. In mouth, a superb sweet chocolate cherry with treacle, maple spread, warming alcohol, nutella, beautiful and rich. Sampled at Bierkraft, Dec. 29 2011.

Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma is raosted malt, canilla, chocolate, coffee, ash and light cherries. Flavour is roasted malt, sour, malt acidic, cherries, vanilla, chocolate, ash and coffee.

Pours thick dark/milk chocolate with a decent creamy dark caramel head. The aroma is awesomely blended with vanilla and fruity sweet sour cherries abrasive and super delicious on the palate, my favorite part. The flavor is a slow arriving of sour cherries on a roasted sweet malt base with a sour cherry ending on the palate. Almost like black cherry soda with a sour ending.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of malt, chocolate, roasting, coffee, cream, vanilla, and light cherry.  Poured pitch black in color with a small to medium-sized, creamy, dense, dark brown head that greatly diminished, but lasted throughout as a film on top of the beer.  Opaque.  Not sparkling.  Flavor is light to medium sweet.  Tastes of malt, roasting, coffee, cherry, and vanilla.  Medium body.  Slightly thin, but otherwise average texture.  Soft to average carbonation.  Malt, roast, cherry, coffee finish is light to medium sweet.  10.9%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

[keg at BrewDog Edinburgh] Black pour, with a thin tan-coloured lacing. Aroma of dark chocolate. The power of suggestion maybe - but it really smells like a slice of black forest gateaux. Mild chocolate on the palate, before a distinct cherry flavour on the palate. Sharp, cherry end, like a good bitter fruitcake. Interesting stuff - the cherry comes out more than the vanilla. Really doesnt taste close to 11%, either [29122011]

Keg at Brewdog Aberdeen. It pours jet black with a small tan head. The nose is varnish, sour tangy fruit, malt vinegar, milk chocolate and icing sugar. The taste is chocolate, sour tangy dark fruit: date, prune, cherry and raisin, over-baked fruit cake, spice and roasted malt, with some alcohol warmth in the finish. Full body, fine carbonation and good balance. Really tasty stuff!

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - pours a black beer with a modest foam retention; deep aroma of black cherries, chewy malts, licorice and black chocolate; a fair sweetness and a robust malt backbone, moderate carbonation; pretty thick and gently sticky; long aftertaste of licorice and black cherries again; lingering roasted chocolatey notes - an unusual profile for a great beer

Tap.  Pours to a pitch black body with a dark brown head.  Aroma is creamy chocolate truffles and brownies.  Flavor is super chocolatey with a very dry spice and light green apples.  Some dry yeasty characters too.  The palate is dry and medium bodied.  Leaves a roasty feel.

500 ml bottle. Very dark brown, almost black. Clear. Medium-sized light beig head that falls down quickly. Dark roasted malts with notes of vanilla, dark chocolate and ash. Rich malty flavours initially, then some fruitiness and sour acidic fruits in the finish. Starts out bold and roasty. Finishes light and sour. Quite interesting, but its edges are a little too sharp.

16.9 oz bottle.  Dark brown with tan froth.  Nose is chocolate, cherry and caramel with hints of pine.  Medium body with a tang.  Taste is sour cherry, bittersweet chocolate and grass.  Tart cherry nicely compliments the earthy mocha and hops.
Bottle. A quite unpleasant milk chocolate taste permeated by a cheap cherry flavour. I dont enjoy the marriage of chocolate and cherry.. Similarly, I did not like this beer.

Bottle at Schouskjelleren Mikrobryggeri. Pours dark, almost black. Aroma of cherry, dark chocolate, vanilla and roasted malt. Taste is just like I remember the chocolate confectionery "Mon Chéri". Pretty good beer, but the cherry/chocolate combination is a bit too much for me. I could drink this as liqueur but not as beer.
From bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is sour fruit and chocolate. Taste is fucked up, sour cherry and vanilla, chocolate. Not my idea of a good time. Bold but not so good
Bottle. Smells like cheap easter egg chocolate. Flavour is much of the same with some shitey cherry. Im balls deep in this so Ill finish under mild duress.

Bottle. A - Poured a clear reddish black color with an average frothy reddish brown head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. S- Moderate to heavy complex toasted malt and tart cherry aroma. M - Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. T - Medium to heavy toasted malt and tart fruit flavor with a medium to heavy toasted sweet finish of moderate duration.  D - My expectation where exceeded.

Keg at Brewdog Camden. Very black, with a big golden brown head. Aroma is lots of milky chocolate, bit of vanilla, touch of coffee, some kahlua. Taste is very creamy chocolate and quite roasty. Quite boozy. Texture is smooth, yet also oily and thick. Very nice. Didnt know this had sour cherries in it and didnt really get the fruitiness. Would like to give it another go.
Great beer.  Black in color with a brown thick head with a red tint.  Aroma is sweet and Chacolaty.  Taste is rich bitter chacolate and finishes with an nice cherry acidity.

Bottle.  Pours dark a viscous.  Produces a beautiful brown head that recedes fairly fast.  The nose is astringent at first but gives way to the roasted malt coffee and chocolate.  Fresh cut grass and hints of leather.  Sadly, I dont smell any cherry as the name implies.  Taste is bitter throughout with a bit of a medicinal taste on the finish which I think is coming from the sour in the cherries.  Not what I had hoped for, but not bad.  I think this beer needs a few years to take away some of the bite.   The mouthfeel is full bodied, thick and creamy at first but dissipates quickly leaving a long lasting bitter taste in the mouth.     I would really like to re-rate this beer after it has a year or two on it.  Its not bad at all.
500 ml thanks to James. Stout or cherry beer? Nice blend between the two. Chocolate and cherry. Twanng in the end. I like it.
Bottle. Black pour with an averaged sized tan / brown head. Cherries, vanilla,  chocolate, some roast, and some caramel. Tastes of cherries, chocolate, fruity, and vanilla. Candyish.

Draft. Pours near black with a brown head. Sweet and roasted malty aroma, with espresso, cherry, and vanilla. The flavor has fresh roasted coffee and vanilla, a light fruity sweetness, cream, and dark chocolate. Good stuff. I didnt really see this as a cherry beer, though I noted cherry in the aroma i didnt really catch it much in the flavor, other that thinking there was a general fruity sweetness. I bet if I went back knowing cherries were used I would notice it more. But in conclusion, I would support changing this from fruit beer to imperial stout, as the stoutiness was more up front than the fruitness, in my opinion.

500mL bottle.  Poured very deep brown with a well-retained dark tan head.. looked great in the glass!  The aroma opened with chocolate-covered cherries, with deeper chocolates and black cherries behind.. just a little smoky character deep down.. warm and well-balanced.  The flavor opened with a touch of smoke and cherry sourness, with burnt black malts, vanilla, and a bit of semi-sweet chocolate behind.. more sour cherries, burnt malts, and vanilla on the finish.. a little bit salty too.. tasty stuff.  Heavier-bodied, sweet, and somewhat smoky on the palate.. the cherries and vanilla worked well in there, and Id gladly drink another (this was pricey, though).

Bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Smells of vanilla, and some sour scents. Tastes of vanilla, cherry. A mild bitter with a medium sweetness and plenty of spices. Medium bodied. Creamy texture. Soft carbonation. Finishes drying.

A very nice winter stout.

Bottle.Very dark brown, small to average and mostly diminishing dark brown head. Moderate, malty and sweet aroma, some caramel and roasted malt with light coffee, some fruitiness and cherries. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, some roasted malt and light coffee, light sour fruitiness with cherries. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, some roasted malt and coffee, light sour fruitiness with cherries. For those with sweet tooth and taste for cherries. Cherries + IS = Why?

500ml bottle from Bierkompass

Pours pitch black with a nice sticky and brown foamy head. Aroma has notes of cherries, roasted malts, vanilla, hops and chocolate. Taste is quite nice with roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla and cherries. Finish is smooth and a tad sour and roasty with chocolate hints. Nice, well balanced and tasty imperial stout with a nice twist.

500 ml bottle.
Pours a black colour with a beautiful beige head. Rich aroma of cherries, milk chocolate, raisins and vanilla. Rich flavour of roasted malts, vanilla, stinging cherries, milk chocolate and brown sugar. Full bodied, dry mouthfeel and a long, warming, dry and chocolatey finish. Really enjoyable. Awesome beer again, Jeppe.

On tap. 
Very pleasant! Black color with a persistent white froth. Chocolate and roasted malt taste. Fruity and spicy cherry. So good!

On tap at local option... Pours darker than emilisse, a deeper black, dar reddish edges and topped with a wispy off-white head... Enticing aroma of rum soaked chocolate covered cherries, marzipan and vanilla, to go alongside a semi-sweet stout base. Very nice... Flavors are semi-sweet charred lightly smoked cherries for the majority while mingling well with the base stout. Not too sweet as the sour cherries provide some relief. Body is a touch bit on the lighter side with adequate carbonation.

Deep  black pour, light brown head fades to a skin with ok retention.  Aroma reminds me of those Creme Saver candies I used to have around Christmas time: sour vanilla, mocha, cherry, chocolate cake, espresso, major roast.  Taste is sour cherry candy, vanilla, smoke, dark chocolate, espresso, licorice, molasses, mint?  Body is full, chewy, almost no carbonation (as indicated by oversized bubbles in the head), oily dense bittersweet molasses coffee cherry finish.  Overall, another unique, extremely wierd beer from Evil Twin that works very well.

Bottle. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma: Small note of cherry sourness, also some roasted things going on, chocoalte etc. Taste: Good balance of sour cherries and roasted coffee and chocolate. Finishes tart.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a dark ruby brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity roasted malty spicy cherry aroma with hints of chocolate. Fruity roasted malty spicy chocolate and cherry flavor. Has a roasted malty sweetish chocolate and cherry finish.

Bottle.
Looks at it should, black with a dark tan head.
Very fruity for a stout, rosted malt and cocholate. Very christmasy!

Comes out of the tap a deep, warm, opaque sable with a fine-bubbled tan head that leaves thick lacing. Rich, chocolaty aroma has notes of caramel and quality coffee as well as hints of licorice and molasses, and is rather sweet. Chocolaty flavor has a noticeable alcohol bite and notes of molasses, caramel, yeast and fine coffee as well as a bitter hint of hops. Thick body is fairly fizzy and leaves a tingly, sweet finish.

Pours a dark brown beer with a brown head. The aroma is malt, licorice, coffee, fruit, cherries and chocolate. The flavor follows the nose with additional ash and tobacco. The palate is sweetness. Overall a good and complex beer.

draft... dark brown with a big, thick, medium tan head, great retention and lacing... fantastic aroma with fresh roasted coffee and vanilla, shockingly excellent... the taste is more roasted vanilla coffee, nice bitter note, light sherries on the back... one of the best evil twin beers, try this
Draught at Churchkey. Oil black, brown bubbles around the edge. Nose is straight cupcake, buttercream icing, and cherry. Flavor is still disgustingly sweet; just frosting, not much else. Brutal.
Alla spina al Beershock di Viterbo. Al naso cacao e liquirizia, corpo deciso, al palato note di cacao intenso, caffè liquirizia, finale sorprendentemente aspro. Ottima, un po poco "soft".
On tap, it is like any cherry stout. It is odd and off putting when you first sip it. But it gets better and better. Definitely has almost a sourness form the cherries.

Drucken med på ölföreningens julölsprovning. Doft av kaffe och mörk choklad. Bitter choklad, lätt syrlig, riktigt hårdrostad, stram och intensiv smakbild. Betydligt kärvare en den vanliga Soft Dookien.

Bottle. Low fluffry off-white quickly disappearing head. Hazy dark brown body. Funny aroma of sour berries and cookies. Flavor likewise sour berries citrus and cookies as well as a vague hint of vanilla. Low carbontion, long aftertaste. Alcohol well hidden. Not my kind of beer but definately different.

Exactly what it  claims to be, a sour dark beer with a mid palate of vanilla. The sour finish lingers moderately and the overall experience Is better than expected. Bouquet improves as it comes to room temperature.

Bottle thx to rlgk cons 2011-12-04 Göteborg
AR: sweetener, rubber, coffey, grape fruit, chocolate, plums
AP: dark brown body, dark beige head
F: sour, chocolate, vanilla, kreik
- Will rerate, have bottle in the celler!

Draught at Bishops Arms, Cph.
Black with a small beige head. Aroma heavy malty(caramel, roasted, chocolate, cherries). Aroma moderate sweet and bitter from the hops and roasted malts. Full body.

Bottle sampled @ Ekstedts tasting on December 2. Courtesy of rlgk. Pours black with a small brown head. Smell is brown sugar, vanilla, milk chocolate and alcohol. Taste is fullbodied and slightly sour with dark chocolate, cherries, coffee, roasted malts, vanilla and alcohol. Finish is dry with coffee.
Bottle (50 cl), courtesy of rlgk. Black with beige head. Milk chocolate aroma with some red berries. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Semi dry, slightly acidic, medium bitterness.
Sampled at Ekstedts Testing 11-12-02. Pours black with a brown head. Smells chocolate and strawberries. Tastes chocolate, cherries, alcohole, vanilla and abit sour with a similar finish.

Bottle at ekstedt tasting on December 2, 20111 pt 0.9 fl oz, BB 2015Black color, smallish dark brown head. Sweet, wood, fudge, brownie with cream, alcohol scent. Sweet, "sour", bitter, canned cherry, chocolate taste. Cocoa, chocolate aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.
Bottle at Ekstedts tasting 2011-12-02. Black beer with a brown head. Vanilla aroma, toffee, cherry, chocolate, sourish and with some hops. Cherry flavor, chocolate, cocoa some hops and vanilla.

Little head. Dark. Bitter chockolate, Bacon, cheese(!). Nice. Fullbody and fine though not monstrous length. Taste is bitter chockolate., fruit, a nice light bitterness. Really fine. and not feeling heavy.

(bottle) pours black with brown head. Fantastic aroma of vanilla ice cream,  chocolate, dark bread, milk, light berries and light hops. The flavour is light sweet, medium bitter and light to medium acidic. Citrus, cherries, roast and hints of hops. The tart and round with light carbonation. Sour cherries, dry cocoa and asphalt in the finish. Medium bodied. I dont like sour stouts.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2011 Tap: Unclear darkbrown beer with a beige head. Choko,bitter fruitiness, liqurice. Sweet and more bitter than you immidiately realise. Oily, softly carbonated. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Pitch black coloured. Dense light Brown head. Vanilla, roast, sweetness, wood, molasses and spice. Flavour og roast, cocoa, sweetness, herbs, spice. And grass. Medium to full bodied. Ends light roasted and light smoked.
On tap at Christian Firtal. Black with a small tan head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, yeast and cherry. Sweetish cherry and roast malt flavour with a yeasty note

Black of color with a reddish brown head. An aroma of Mon Cheri - chocolate, spice, sweets, cherries, roasted, weak liqurice and dark chocolate. A flavor of liqurice, roasted malt, cherries, chocolate, vanilla, spice, weak sweets - still hints of Mon Cheri chocolate.

25-NOV-2011, bottle @home, from "Fish & Beer".
Beautiful black with lasting high brown head. 
Nose is coffee, really hard roasted, with vanilla cherries. Fantastic!
Taste is again hard roasted almost burnt coffee with a dry coco touch. Tart cherries almost turn marzipan nutty and vanilla. 
A little sweetness balances the burnt roadt. 
Low carbonation and full palate. Ahm, want more...

50cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2011, thx to Jeppe!, complex Stout with cherries, fruity/roasted and slightly sweet/sour, yet balanced, hazy, small head, good and original X-Mas brew, yet expensive!

Bottle @home from ØlKonsortiet. Pours black with a nice long lasting beige/red-ishhead. Cherry (big surprise), roasty aroma. Full bodied, almost sweet finishes with a little fruity tartness that finishes everything off very nicely.

Bottle 500ml.Clear dark black brown colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, light brown - pink head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chcolate, cherry, cacao. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, tart cherry, dark chocolate, cheap cacao pudder, vanialla notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20111105]

Pours an opaque black with a dark beige head and lacings. Smells of vanilla and taosted malts. Sweet and dry with hints of sourness from the cherries. First you taste malty a sweetnes. That is quickly followed by aromas of cherries and rounded off with almonds and vanilla. Full bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Long fininsh wtih lots of vanilla.

Tap @ Fairbar. Pours black with a small tan head leaving nice lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, sour cherries. Taste is roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, milk chocolate, sour cherries, notes of wood / cherry stones. Full body, soft carbonation, sweet / tart sticking finish. Abit on the sweet side, but very good. 031111
Bottle @ Ulfborg, Early Winter Tasting, 2011. Pours nearly black with a creamy beige head and lacings. Vanilla, vague spice, berries and roast.  Cookie dough. Vaguely acidic. No . .

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ tasting.Pours dark brown with a beige head.Aroma of chocolate, coffee, nuts, caramel, vanilla and malt.Flavor is sweet and malty with some cherries and roasted malt,coffee,chocolate and nuts.
Medium to full body, average carbonation.

Bottle. A black one, with a reddish tint. Theres a reddish touch the head as well, its dense, fingerthick and brown. Some vanilla in the aroma, also a hint of cherries, with roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and a hint of caramel. Unusual flavor for an imperial stout, but the added vanilla and cherries gives it a nice and interesting touch. Some bitterness towards the end. Full-bodied, smooth and lighlty warming. I like it, its unusual, but tasteful. 111105
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are cherries, roast malt, vanilla, cocoa and hops.

Bottle @ FOneFan. Almost black with medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and dark fruits. Flavour is roasted malts, vanilla, cherries, chocolate, little coffee, little acid and medium bitter.

Bottle. Pours black with a khaki head. Aroma is complex and a bit weird, but interesting; tart and roasted with notes of dark fruit and diarrhea (!) - but in a good way. As it warms, the latter subsides and gives way to notes of chocolate and sweet liquorice. Flavour is dusty with sweet malt, chocolate, spicy notes and an alcohol burn. Tart, ashy, dry, sweet roasted finish. Overall it walks a thin line between a complete clash of notes and being well-balanced; its interesting and pretty good, but doesnt go all the way. Also, rather cloying in the long run. 05.11.11.

Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla and cherries. Flavor is quite sweet, rather bitter and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish with moderate bitterness. 031111

Bottle.My x-mas beer rating no.6.Pitch black colour with beige head,who stays.Aroma is rosted with taste of chocolate and vanilla but also sweet of cherries,feels a bit unbalanced with peppery finish.

on tap. appearance pitch black, with a small beige head, Aroma, sawdust, vanilla, chocolate, roasted, oak, some cherries, sweetness, medium mouthfeel, taste: upfront you get the tartness of the cherries, vanilla, coffee, hard burnt, sawdust, medium bitterness, fruityness, port wine, light minerally, a party in my mouth. or more like a journey with loads of different impressions from start till finish
A funny tasting beer. Both the cherry taste of a fruit beer and the roasted taste of a dark beer.
Nose is heavy chocolate, urinal cakes, mediumroasted malt, feel Is mediumwatery, carb Is medium, taste is port, decent roasted malt, coffee, oak, late sour note

Rating #654, flaske fra Toft Vin medbragt til Julebrygsmagning 2011 af mig selv  

En knaldsort skabelse med brunt soft. Duften er kaffe og chokolade; kirsebær-smagen skinner ikke igennem før smagen hvor den efterlader en sursød bismag i det kaffeprægede landskab. Tyk og cremet indtryk. Lækker.

Bottle. Pours jet black with a medium creamy dense brown head. The aroma is hard roasted malt, chocolate, light coffee, vanilla and sweet cherries. The flavour is bit sour at first. Then comes the hard roasted malt and the vanilla and chocolate and it ends up with a cherries sour note.

50 cL bottle. Pours dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is dark roasted malt, mixed vanilla and just a hint of cherry. Cherry becomes more distinct for each sip of the beer and becomes somewhat disconnected from the rest of the beer. The dark malt and vanilla seems to stick well together - although a bit too vanilla. Strangely it somewhat works together yet for the most as three disconnected flavours: dark malt, cherry and vanilla.

Bottle, bought @ Havnens Vin og Tobak, Vejle.
Pours completely black with a small, creamy, pinkish beige head. Aroma is sweet, chocolate, cherries. Medium carbonation, fine dry and light tartish mouthfeel. Flavour has chocolate, light coffee, mild fruit. Lingering dry, mild acidic and fairly bitter finish. A very nice fruit/stout combo.

Bottle, 50 cl. Pours pitch black with a nice mocha brown head. Aroma has a lot of cherries and christmas spices - especially cinnamon. Behind that notes of chocolate and vanilla mostly, but also caramel and roasted malts. But pretty dominated by cherries and christmasness. The taste is kinda weird. It has the sour cherries up front, but also another type of red berries, more specifically red currants, which has some astringency that also shows in the beer. Im surprised in how not roasted this beer is. The cherries make it rather fresh, but also christmas spices dominate the taste. A hint of sweet chocolate in the finish, but the finish is mainly focused on the astringency and spiciness from the cherries. Surprisingly quaffable for a 11% beer, but it gets a bit much.
Bottle at Papsøs - Thanks. Black - brown head. Red berries, cherries, sour cherries, fruity, milkey, dryness, light acid notes, vanilla, burned malts, dried fruits, high malty. Nice.

Bottle 500ml @ Papsoe
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate and cherries. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat to soft.

Bottle. Poured black with a large, active head. Smells only vaguely of cherry, despite cherry being more dominant in the taste, but lots of vanilla. Roasted malts and alcohol besides. The same chalkiness as Soft Dookie, hence the name.

Bottle at Papsø.
Pitch black coloured with a huge beige head.
Roasted aroma of dark chocolate and vanilla.
Roasted flavour of berries and dark chocolate with notes of cocoa powder.
Roasted finish.

pitch dark, smooth brown head.
roasted malts, faint fruits.
flavor is roasted malts, nice fruity note, charchoal, quite refreshing, but also a little candy like. quite interesting.

Bottled. A pitch black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of alcohol, roasted malt, and wood. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, alcohol, soy sauce, and some wood, leading to a dry alcoholic finish. Thanks joergen for sharing.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of joergen. Pours a pitch black with a brown head. Very sweet roast in the nose with a heavy load of vanilla and some butterscotch. Solid body, sweet roast, the vanilla comes through again and the sour cherries do add a slight tartness. Quite a fun creation. 131011
